page.title: 15A prefect: Glenalmond
page.content: Boys of eighteen study various subjects, but in this case the boy studies Geography, English and Ancient History for A-level. In his spare time he reads novels and plays tennis and basketball. He also listens to music in his study. The boy thinks that public school prepares one for later life, but it is a disadvantage to be away from home for such long periods. He thinks a cafeteria system should be established, and finds juniors arrogant. He also feels that more facilities should be introduced, including more tennis courts. After leaving the school, he looks forward to University and married life. He wishes to relax after A-levels and find a job. On the whole, this boy does not enjoy public school life; he finds it trivial and boring.
